Class GameRenderer

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.ui.GameRenderer
public class GameRenderer extends Object
Renders the board, active brick, next bricks, and hold brick, supporting standard and upside-down visual modes with utility effects.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Eashwar

  • Constructor Details

    • GameRenderer

      public GameRenderer(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane brickPanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanel1, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanel2, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanel3, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane holdBrickPanel, javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty gamePanelSceneX, javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty gamePanelSceneY)
      Constructs a renderer with panels and positioning bindings.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - main board panel
      brickPanel - active brick panel
      nextBrickPanel1 - next brick panel (1)
      nextBrickPanel2 - next brick panel (2)
      nextBrickPanel3 - next brick panel (3)
      holdBrickPanel - hold brick panel
      gamePanelSceneX - bound scene X for positioning
      gamePanelSceneY - bound scene Y for positioning

  • Method Details

    • setUpsideDown

      public void setUpsideDown(boolean value)
      Enables or disables upside-down rendering.
      Parameters:
      value - whether upside-down mode is active

    • getVisualRow

      public int getVisualRow(int logicRow, int totalHeight)
      Maps a logical row to the visual row based on mode.
      Parameters:
      logicRow - the logical matrix row
      totalHeight - total rows in the matrix
      Returns:
      visual row index

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initializes all panels and grids for rendering.
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - background matrix
      brick - current view data

    • createGrid

      private javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[][] createGrid(int rows, int cols, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane panel, Object dataFn)
      Creates a grid of rectangles and optionally assigns colors.
      Parameters:
      rows - number of rows
      cols - number of columns
      panel - panel to populate
      dataFn - either a boolean indicating board or a color matrix
      Returns:
      created rectangle grid
